thread.title: Ghanaian Players Abroad: Babas Premier League debut, Mahatma Otoos brace, Gyan and Muntari make injury return plus more
thread.title_full: Ghanaian Players Abroad: Babas Premier League debut, Mahatma Otoos brace, Gyan and Muntari make injury return plus more

title: Ghanaian Players Abroad: Babas Premier League debut, Mahatma Otoos brace, Gyan and Muntari make injury return plus more
text:
FIFA 2010   23:26 CET Ghanaian Players Abroad: Baba’s Premier League debut, Mahatma Otoo’s brace, Gyan and Muntari make injury return plus more - www.allsports.com.gh 
Chelsea defender Abdul Baba Rahman made his English Premier League debut against international team-mate Jordan Ayew 's Aston Villa. Ghanaian left-back Baba Rahman played the full game as Chelsea won by two goals to nil at Stamford Bridge. Jordan Ayew was substituted in the 68th minute of the game. 
Christian Atsu missed AFC Bournemouth's 5-1 thrashing away from home by Manchester City. 
Leicester City's Jeffrey Schlupp was given 45 minutes of playing time as his side came from two goals down to draw level at 2-2 in their away game against Southampton. 
In the English Championship, Albert Adomah made a 57th minute appearance for Middlesbrough in the their goalless draw game at home to Fulham. 
Afriyie Acquah played the full duration for Torino in their home game against AC Milan. The Ghanaian and his side shared the spoils with one goal apiece against visiting side AC Milan. 
Dennis Appiah played the full game for Caen in the French Ligue 1 on Saturday as they won by a goal to nil against Reins. play
